title: Love Actually is getting a special sequel for Red Nose Day | Metro News
text:
Adam Starkey for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 6:12 pm Love Actually is coming back (Picture: Universal Pictures) 
Fans of rom-coms everywhere rejoice: Love Actually is getting a special sequel for this year’s Red Nose Day. 27 throwback photos from the Love Actually premiere in 2003, just because 
The hugely popular 2003 film will receive a ten-minute special sequel for Comic Relief and Red Nose Day, which will reunite many of the original cast members. 
Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Keira Knightley, Liam Neeson, Colin Firth, Andrew Lincoln and Bill Nighy are just some of the main players confirmed to return. Andrew Lincoln is even back after huge success with The Walking Dead (Picture: Universal) 
If that wasn’t impressive enough, Lucia Moniz, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Olivia Olson, Marcus Brigstocke and Rowan Atkinson are also set to reprise their original roles too. 
Basically, Hugh Grant dancing to Girls Aloud round two is a go-go. 
Original writer and director Richard Curtis is on board to helm the Red Nose Day special, which will revisit the characters 14 years later in the present day. 
Speaking about the special, Curtis said: ‘Over the years I’ve enjoyed doing Red Nose Day specials on TV things I’ve worked on – Blackadder, The Vicar of Dibley, and Mr Bean.
